verses.verse: And when Balaam <WH1109> saw <WH7200> <WH8799> that it pleased <WH5869> <WH2895> <WH8804> the YY <WH3068> to bless <WH1288> <WH8763> Yisra'EL <WH3478>, he went <WH1980> <WH8804> not, as at other times <WH6471>, to seek <WH7125> <WH8800> for enchantments <WH5173>, but he set <WH7896> <WH8799> his face <WH6440> toward the wilderness <WH4057>.

And Balaam <WH1109> lifted up <WH5375> <WH8799> his eyes <WH5869>, and he saw <WH7200> <WH8799> Yisra'EL <WH3478> abiding <WH7931> <WH8802> in his tents according to their tribes <WH7626>; and the spirit <WH7307> of 'Elohim <WH430> came upon him.

And he took up <WH5375> <WH8799> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559> <WH8799>, Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> hath said <WH5002> <WH8803>, and the man <WH1397> whose eyes <WH5869> are open <WH8365> <WH8803> hath said <WH5002> <WH8803>:

He hath said <WH5002> <WH8803>, which heard <WH8085> <WH8802> the words <WH561> of 'Elohim <WH410>, which saw <WH2372> <WH8799> the vision <WH4236> of 'El SHaddai <WH7706>, falling <WH5307> <WH8802> into a trance, but having his eyes <WH5869> open <WH1540> <WH8803>:
How goodly <WH2895> <WH8804> are thy tents <WH168>, O Ya`akov <WH3290>, and thy tabernacles <WH4908>, O Yisra'EL <WH3478> !

As the valleys <WH5158> are they spread forth <WH5186> <WH8738>, as gardens <WH1593> by the river's side <WH5104>, as the trees of lign aloes <WH174> which the YY <WH3068> hath planted <WH5193> <WH8804>, and as cedar trees <WH730> beside the waters <WH4325>.

He shall pour <WH5140> the water <WH4325> out <WH5140> <WH8799> of his buckets <WH1805>, and his seed <WH2233> shall be in many <WH7227> waters <WH4325>, and his king <WH4428> shall be higher <WH7311> <WH8799> than Agag <WH90>, and his kingdom <WH4438> shall be exalted <WH5375> <WH8691>.

'Elohim <WH410> brought him forth <WH3318> <WH8688> out of Egypt <WH4714>; he hath as it were the strength <WH8443> of an unicorn <WH7214>: he shall eat up <WH398> <WH8799> the nations <WH1471> his enemies <WH6862>, and shall break <WH1633> <WH8762> their bones <WH6106>, and pierce <WH4272> <WH8799> them through with his arrows <WH2671>.

He couched <WH3766> <WH8804>, he lay down <WH7901> <WH8804> as a lion <WH738>, and as a great lion <WH3833>: who shall stir him up <WH6965> <WH8686>? Blessed <WH1288> <WH8803> is he that blesseht <WH1288> <WH8764> thee, and cursed <WH779> <WH8803> is he that curseht <WH779> <WH8802> thee.

And Balak's <WH1111> anger <WH639> was kindled <WH2734> <WH8799> against Balaam <WH1109>, and he smote <WH5606> his hands <WH3709> together <WH5606> <WH8799>: and Balak <WH1111> said <WH559> <WH8799> unto Balaam <WH1109>, I called <WH7121> <WH8804> thee to curse <WH6895> <WH8800> mine enemies <WH341> <WH8802>, and, behold, thou hast altogether <WH1288> <WH8763> blessed <WH1288> <WH8765> them these three <WH7969> times <WH6471>.

Therefore now flee <WH1272> <WH8798> thou to thy place <WH4725>: I thought <WH559> <WH8804> to promote <WH3513> thee unto great <WH3513> <WH8763> honour <WH3513> <WH8762>; but, lo, the YY <WH3068> hath kept thee back <WH4513> <WH8804> from honour <WH3519>.
And Balaam <WH1109> said <WH559> <WH8799> unto Balak <WH1111>, Spake <WH1696> <WH8765> I not also to thy messengers <WH4397> which thou sentest <WH7971> <WH8804> unto me, saying <WH559> <WH8800>,

If Balak <WH1111> would give <WH5414> <WH8799> me his house <WH1004> full <WH4393> of silver <WH3701> and gold <WH2091>, I cannot <WH3201> <WH8799> go beyond <WH5674> <WH8800> the Mitzvah <WH6310> of the YY <WH3068>, to do <WH6213> <WH8800> either good <WH2896> or bad <WH7451> of mine own mind <WH3820>; but what the YY <WH3068> saith <WH1696> <WH8762>, that will I speak <WH1696> <WH8762> ?

And now, behold, I go <WH1980> <WH8802> unto my people <WH5971>: come <WH3212> <WH8798> therefore, and I will advertise <WH3289> <WH8799> thee what this people <WH5971> shall do <WH6213> <WH8799> to thy people <WH5971> in the latter <WH319> days <WH3117>.

And he took up <WH5375> <WH8799> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559> <WH8799>, Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> hath said <WH5002> <WH8803>, and the man <WH1397> whose eyes <WH5869> are open <WH8365> <WH8803> hath said <WH5002> <WH8803>:

He hath said <WH5002> <WH8803>, which heard <WH8085> <WH8802> the words <WH561> of 'Elohim <WH410>, and knew <WH3045> <WH8802> the knowledge <WH1847> of Ha `Elyon <WH5945>, which saw <WH2372> <WH8799> the vision <WH4236> of 'El SHaddai <WH7706>, falling <WH5307> <WH8802> into a trance, but having his eyes <WH5869> open <WH1540> <WH8803>:

I shall see <WH7200> <WH8799> him, but not now: I shall behold <WH7789> <WH8799> him, but not nigh <WH7138>: there shall come <WH1869> <WH8804> a Star <WH3556> out of Ya`akov <WH3290>, and a Sceptre <WH7626> shall rise <WH6965> <WH8804> out of Yisra'EL <WH3478>, and shall smite <WH4272> <WH8804> the corners <WH6285> of Moab <WH4124>, and destroy <WH6979> <WH8773> all the children <WH1121> of Sheth <WH8352> <WH8676> <WH8351>.

And Edom <WH123> shall be a possession <WH3424>, Seir <WH8165> also shall be a possession <WH3424> for his enemies <WH341> <WH8802>; and Yisra'EL <WH3478> shall do <WH6213> <WH8802> valiantly <WH2428>.
Out of Ya`akov <WH3290> shall come he that shall have dominion <WH7287> <WH8799>, and shall destroy <WH6> <WH8689> him that remaineth <WH8300> of the city <WH5892>.

And when he looked <WH7200> <WH8799> on Amalek <WH6002>, he took up <WH5375> <WH8799> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559> <WH8799>, Amalek <WH6002> was the first <WH7225> of the nations <WH1471>; but his latter <WH319> end shall be that he perish <WH8> for ever <WH5703>.

And he looked <WH7200> <WH8799> on the Kenites <WH7017>, and took up <WH5375> <WH8799> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559> <WH8799>, Strong <WH386> is thy dwellingplace <WH4186>, and thou puttest <WH7760> <WH8798> thy nest <WH7064> in a rock <WH5553>.
Nevertheless the Kenite <WH7014> shall <WH518> be wasted <WH1197> <WH8763>, until Asshur <WH804> shall carry thee away captive <WH7617> <WH8799>.
And he took up <WH5375> <WH8799> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559> <WH8799>, Alas <WH188>, who shall live <WH2421> <WH8799> when 'Elohim <WH410> doeth <WH7760> <WH8800> this!

And ships <WH6716> shall come from the coast <WH3027> of Chittim <WH3794>, and shall afflict <WH6031> <WH8765> Asshur <WH804>, and shall afflict <WH6031> <WH8765> Eber <WH5677>, and he also shall perish <WH8> for ever <WH5703>.
And Balaam <WH1109> rose up <WH6965> <WH8799>, and went <WH3212> <WH8799> and returned <WH7725> <WH8799> to his place <WH4725>: and Balak <WH1111> also went <WH1980> <WH8804> his way <WH1870>.
